\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
Etacad is a module aimed at simplifying and/or automating the drawing of structural element plans based on the ezdxf library.
Etacad is not a structural calculation module; it only performs drawing functions and material computation.

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Getting started}
\label{\detokenize{gettingstarted:getting-started}}\label{\detokenize{gettingstarted::doc}}

\section{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{gettingstarted:installation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If you have pip:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{etacad}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{itemize}

\chapter{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{usage:usage}}\label{\detokenize{usage::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
For the following examples, we will use variable ‘doc’as an instance of ezdxf.new().

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{ezdxf}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Creating a new document}
\label{\detokenize{usage:creating-a-new-document}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Pass the setup parameter as True to use the dimensions and text styles from the ezdxf module. By default, etacad
uses them.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{doc} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{ezdxf}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{new}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{R2010}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{setup}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{True}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Creating a Beam instance}
\label{\detokenize{usage:creating-a-beam-instance}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a simple concrete beam with {\hyperref[\detokenize{API:etacad.beam.Beam}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Beam}}}}} class.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Importing Beam class.}
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{etacad} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Beam}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Creating a basic Beam instance.}
\PYG{n}{beam} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Beam}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.2}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{height}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.35}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{length}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{y}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}sup}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}inf}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}db}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.15}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{cover}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.025}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{x} and \sphinxtitleref{y} parameters correspond to the default point where the drawings will be plotted unless specified when
executing the drawing methods.


\subsection{Beam bars}
\label{\detokenize{usage:beam-bars}}\label{\detokenize{usage:beam-bars-label}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
You can add more steel bars by specifying their diameter as the key and the quantity as the dictionary values. These
will be symmetrically arranged along the width or effective height of the section. You can add bars vertically using
the parameters \sphinxtitleref{as\_right} and \sphinxtitleref{as\_left}. The cover is considered at the bar’s centerline.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{beam} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Beam}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.2}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{height}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.35}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{length}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}sup}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.01}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}right}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}inf}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}left}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}db}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.15}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{cover}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.025}\PYG{p}{)}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} The cover is considered at the bar\PYGZsq{}s centerline.}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
You can also add an anchorage length for the bars using \sphinxtitleref{anchor\_sup}, \sphinxtitleref{anchor\_right}, \sphinxtitleref{anchor\_inf}, and \sphinxtitleref{anchor\_left},
passing a single value for all the bars on the side or a list specifying a value for each bar.


\subsection{Beam stirrups}
\label{\detokenize{usage:beam-stirrups}}\label{\detokenize{usage:beam-stirrups-label}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The stirrups are handled differently than the bars. You can specify a single diameter and spacing (as in the previous
example), which will distribute the stirrups along the beam, or you can provide a list of diameters, requiring
additional parameters such as the X coordinate where each stirrup begins and the reinforcement length. Additionally,
you can provide a list of the anchorage lengths for each stirrup or a float for all stirrups.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{beam} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Beam}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.2}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{height}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.35}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{length}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}sup}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.01}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}inf}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}db}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.01}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.15}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.15}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}length}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.6}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.6}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}anchor}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.125}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.2}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{cover}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.025}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Beam columns intersections}
\label{\detokenize{usage:beam-columns-intersections}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Intersections of the columns can be taken into account; we need to introduce three additional parameters:
\sphinxtitleref{columns}, \sphinxtitleref{columns\_pos}, and \sphinxtitleref{columns\_symbol}, the latter being optional.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{beam} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Beam}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.2}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{height}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.35}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{length}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}sup}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}inf}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}db}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.15}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{columns}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.2}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.35}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.35}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{columns\PYGZus{}pos}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{3.65}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{columns\PYGZus{}symbol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{C2}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{cover}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.025}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Longitudinal drawing of the beam}
\label{\detokenize{usage:longitudinal-drawing-of-the-beam}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Beam class offers methods for drawing longitudinal and cross sections, which are customizable through the method
parameters and the \sphinxtitleref{settings} parameter.
Each method returns a dictionary that may or may not contain other nested dictionaries (depending on the method and
class). The keys that do not have dictionaries contain a list of DXF entities.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{beam}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{draw\PYGZus{}longitudinal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{document}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{doc}\PYG{p}{,}
                       \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
                       \PYG{n}{y}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}
                       \PYG{n}{unifilar\PYGZus{}bars}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
See more about the parameters of the {\hyperref[\detokenize{API:etacad.beam.Beam.draw_longitudinal}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Beam.draw\_longitudinal()}}}}} function for further details.


\subsection{Transversal drawing of the beam}
\label{\detokenize{usage:transversal-drawing-of-the-beam}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{beam}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{draw\PYGZus{}transverse}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{document}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{doc}\PYG{p}{,}
                     \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
                     \PYG{n}{y}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\section{Creating a Column instance}
\label{\detokenize{usage:creating-a-column-instance}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a simple concrete column with {\hyperref[\detokenize{API:etacad.column.Column}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Column}}}}} class.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Importing Column class.}
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{etacad} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Column}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Creating a basic Column instance.}
\PYG{n}{column} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Column}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{depth}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{height}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{y}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}sup}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}right}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}inf}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}left}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}db}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.15}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{cover}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.025}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxtitleref{x} and \sphinxtitleref{y} parameters correspond to the default point where the drawings will be plotted unless specified when
executing the drawing methods.


\subsection{Column bars}
\label{\detokenize{usage:column-bars}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
It works the same as the {\hyperref[\detokenize{usage:beam-bars-label}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Beam bars}}}} section. The consideration here is that symmetrical columns are
generally used, and all the bar parameters (as\_sup, as\_right, as\_inf, as\_left) should be utilized. It must be noted that
the bars at the edges apply to two faces of the section, as considered in this example.


\subsection{Column stirrups}
\label{\detokenize{usage:column-stirrups}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
It works the same as the {\hyperref[\detokenize{usage:beam-stirrups-label}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{std,std-ref}{Beam stirrups}}}} section.


\subsection{Column beams intersections}
\label{\detokenize{usage:column-beams-intersections}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Intersections of the beams can be taken into account; we need to introduce three additional parameters:
\sphinxtitleref{beams}, \sphinxtitleref{beams\_pos}, and \sphinxtitleref{beams\_symbol}, the latter being optional.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{column} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Column}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{width}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{depth}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{height}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{y}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}sup}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}right}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}inf}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{as\PYGZus{}left}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.012}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}db}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.008}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{stirrups\PYGZus{}sep}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.15}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{beams}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{.25}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{beams\PYGZus{}pos}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{5.75}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{beams\PYGZus{}symbol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{B1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{B2}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
                \PYG{n}{cover}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mf}{.025}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{Longitudinal drawing of the column}
\label{\detokenize{usage:longitudinal-drawing-of-the-column}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The Column class offers methods for drawing longitudinal and cross sections, which are customizable through the method
parameters and the \sphinxtitleref{settings} parameter.
Each method returns a dictionary that may or may not contain other nested dictionaries (depending on the method and
class). The keys that do not have dictionaries contain a list of DXF entities.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{column}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{draw\PYGZus{}longitudinal}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{document}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{doc}\PYG{p}{,}
                         \PYG{n}{x}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}
                         \PYG{n}{y}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}
                         \PYG{n}{unifilar\PYGZus{}bars}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
See more about the parameters of the {\hyperref[\detokenize{API:etacad.column.Column.draw_longitudinal}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Column.draw\_longitudinal()}}}}} function for further details.

\section{Methods}
\label{\detokenize{API:methods}}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{draw\_longitudinal(document, x=None, y=None, dimensions=True, dimensions\_inner=True, settings=CONCRETE\_SET\_LONG)}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Draws the concrete section in the longitudinal direction with optional dimensioning.

\sphinxlineitem{draw\_transverse(document, x=None, y=None, dimensions=True, dimensions\_boxing=True, dimensions\_inner=True,}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{settings=CONCRETE\_SET\_TRANSVERSE)}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Draws the concrete section in the transverse direction with optional dimensioning.

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}

stirrups, and bars. Also includes dimensioning and optional middle axes.
